Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Close to Transit”
Reviews.Author: GinaK92
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent three nights at the Renaissance Chicago O'Hare Suites Hotel due to our daughter marching with the band in the St. Patrick's Day parade. We booked our package which included the room through the school. We were picked up at the airport by the complimentary shuttle and taken back to the hotel. Check in was very easy and the staff were super nice. One of the best features of this hotel is it's close proximity to the train station, which makes traveling to the city very convenient. The cons of this hotel was the fact that the cleaning was a little lacking. It was not vacuum very well before our arrival or during our stay. The bathroom could use updating, as the tub's grout was black in some places. Overall a decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Park, sleep, & fly deal was great!”
Reviews.Author: bucaam
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, close to the airport, very kind staff, etc. We were very pleased with our experience and would recommend to anyone! Rooms were very clean, quiet, and the staff was fantastic! They gave us a 4pm checkout since our flight left in the evening. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Park Sleep & Fly”
Reviews.Author: Chuckiepoo
Reviews.Content: We have used this location two times for this purpose. They have very nice rooms and 24 hour shuttle service to Ohare. I booked it through Park Sleep and Fly, and saved about $20 over the hotel charges.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: CheeseheadsII
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance on March 1, 2012 as a Park and Fly package. Very close to the highway and the airport. The shuttle runs every half hour. The parking is covered. The room was great and very quiet. Would stay there again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfortable and Priced Right”
Reviews.Author: lizzy2302
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel using their Park Sleep Fly program. Check in & Check out went smoothly and the reception personnel were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very large since they're suites, bathrooms were nice and beds very comfortable. The hotel overall is updated and clean. We ate dinner in the bar area and thought the prices were reasonable for a hotel in Chicago and the food was really good. The shuttle was prompt (every half hour for both pickup at the hotel and pickup at the airport, no reservation or phone calls required). We had a very early flight in the a.m. and our return flight got in very late, so it was important that the shuttle run 24 hours. Not all the hotels in the Park Sleep Fly program offer 24 hour service. Parking was covered and secure, which was also another perk other hotels did not all offer. The biggest thing for us was probably the fact when we arrived back at the hotel at about 1:00 a.m., we just wanted to get home after a long vacation and found the car battery dead. At that hour, there wasn't anyone around to ask for a jump and it would have taken 3-4 hours for Roadside Assistance to get there. I had resigned to the idea of just paying for another night at the hotel, but we asked the reception staff if anyone might be able to help us, and within minutes their hotel maintenance engineer was there with a portable jump starter and she stayed with us until we were sure the car battery was not going to die again. I wish I were better at remembering names, because we would love to give her a special thanks. They were so helpful and no one was cranky that we were asking for help in the middle of the night (which was on a whim, I never thought they would have someone around who would help us and for FREE). I would definitely stay here again. For a very small amount more you can stay at this very nice hotel instead of several other chains that are not nearly as nice, and it is worth every penny for the convenience, comfort and extremely friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Tammy K
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the hotel for two nights through their park and fly program. What a fabulous place! The rooms were gorgeous. The restaurant was excellent. Staff was very friendly. Airport shuttle was very prompt.

Reviews.Title: “park and fly”
Reviews.Author: lilly5371
Reviews.Content: this was our first time trying out the park and fly experience and we were so pleased by it. Our flight was 7 a.m. saturday morning so we drove to hotel friday early evening, checked into a lovely room, then had cocktails and dinner in the hotel bar. Then we went to bed, got up early and the shuttle was downstairs already ready to take us. it was a 5 minute drive to the intl terminal. Driver was very helpful with the luggage and gave clear instructions for the return pickup. So, once we returned and called for the pickup, I kid you not .... he was there in 5 minutes. We got back to hotel and since our car was in covered parking, no problem with starting it and heading on our way. Our room price included 14 days of parking so it was a real bargain. We will certainly do this again and the shuttle service was superb. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great airport overnight. Wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ohiofamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight prior to a flight out to LA. Rooms are spacious. If you have kids, there is a pull-out sofa in the "suite" area that could also accommodate a roll-away. Bathroom is updated but lighting is not so good. Also, planes do land at 5 a.m. right over the hotel. They have a fridge and a safe in the room if you need it. There is a Starbucks downstairs. Breakfast is awesome and staff is extremely accommodating. Shuttle is prompt at the airport as well as the hotel. This is a really good airport hotel! Didn't use it, but it seems that the train to Chicago is right across the street. Very convenient. I turned my rental car in before I arrived at the hotel, saving $24 for the parking charge.

Reviews.Title: “Everything lacking is wireless...”
Reviews.Author: Strick3
Reviews.Content: Stff very professional and rooms great. But why no wireless in the rooms?

Reviews.Title: “Easy to Find, Covered Parking!”
Reviews.Author: thewhirledtraveler
Reviews.Content: Traveling from Chicago in the winter months certainly poses some challenges! At the Renaissance, at least scraping a week's worth of ice off your windows and digging out your car isn't one of them :) The rooms are clean and comfortable, there is a nice little bar for pre-vacation celebrations, and the shuttle is timely and efficient. I have stayed here several times as a park-and-fly deal, and it's perfect for an early morning flight. It is easy to get to, the staff are friendly and helpful, and it takes the stress of getting to the airport off your back. I'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Park & Fly”
Reviews.Author: wicowboyfan
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel as part of or vacation as part of their park and fly program. We stayed 01-25-12 and 02-03-12. The rate was one of the best we found near the airport and the reviews were pleasant. Our room was even nicer than we expected. Quiet, comfy and good temperature control. The shuttle was convenient and on time. I will definitely stay here again we we fly out of O'Hare!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Park & Fly”
Reviews.Author: 4qqqq
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a park and fly out of O'Hare Airport. The rooms were clean and comfortable. They use Aveda products for the hotel samples. Nice touch. Easy access on & off the freeway. Shuttle service was perfect. There is a bar in the lobby that had great martinis. This is an excellent place to use. I will not hesitate go stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overnite before a vacation”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Sartori_2004
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property the night before a flight out of O'Hare airport. It was booked through a ParkSleepFly. What a great hotel. All amenities up to date. Check-in was very smooth and timely. King bed was comfortable and had a beautiful bathroom, huge shower. Nice bar just off the lobby. The shuttle to the airport was on time and the driver very helpful with all luggage. Just 10 minutes to airport. Price was real reasonable. Overall, a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a little cumbersome and additional parking charges.”
Reviews.Author: Noodlechecker
Reviews.Content: Renaissance is my favorite Marriott brand and this hotel fit the typical Renaissance model. The bed was great, the room was nice. My room had only a shower and not a tub but that was o.k. for me. Due to it's proximity to O'Hare there is a daily charge of $20 for parking that you would not have to pay if you went a little further out. It was a little cumbersome with using the attached parking garage with all all of your luggage. Plus there were not many eating choices near by. I would probably stay someplace else if I travel to the area for work again.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit...always perfection!”
Reviews.Author: beachdjk
Reviews.Content: This was our third Park, Sleep, Fly stay at this hotel...staying both before and after our trips. Service, rooms, restaurant are all great. Plus, the shuttle will take you to area restaurants in between their airport trips. The covered parking is a plus when traveling during the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: Nances3355
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms prior to our flight out to CA..location, roomy suites, friendly and helpful staff made our stay so nice...we would definitely stay again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Mike L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before our trip to Hawaii & was very impressed! We booked this hotel through ParkSleepFly.com & got a great rate for parking our car for 14 days. The room was very nice & had a lot of room. It is a suite, with the living room & bedroom in separate rooms...also had a flat screen TV in each room. The bathroom was huge & had a nice glass enclosed shower, which we always like. We ate at the bar that evening & the food wasn't all that great, but it will do for last minute hunger. Overall, this is a really nice hotel & the staff was very friendly & professional. I would definitely recommend to anyone staying in the Chicago area!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for park and stay!”
Reviews.Author: travellOVER2010_10
Reviews.Content: We paid 109 dollars to stay the night here and then leave our car in their covered parking lot for 7 days while we where on vacation. They have a free shuttle that runs 24 hours to and from ohare for your departure and return. The room was adequate with two nice tv's and a really nice big bathroom with huge walk in shower. Bed was very comfortable and staff was nice. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay near ohare. It's updated and clean,with a nice cocktail lounge off the lobby. Also has a Starbucks connected to it!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott's usual”
Reviews.Author: SunshineKaren
Reviews.Content: While the room was large and clean, a few things just weren't up to my usual experiences at Marriotts. The telephone in the bedroom didn't work, the remote controls were dirty, the toilet lever had to be held down quite a while to get the toilet to flush. As with my experience in Vail, the Concierge (or what passed for the Concierge) had a bit of an attitude with my inquiry about lost gloves. I guess it wasn't important enough for her time. During one of our meetings, the water was never refreshed after lunch (understandable due to the circumstances), however it took an hour between a personal request to the meeting manager, a phone call to the front desk, and then a visit to the front desk to finally get fresh water. The staff with the most helpful attitude were the valets, housekeeping, and a few at the front desk. But overall, the attitude was not up to Marriott's usual level.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: weathergirl1067
Reviews.Content: This was a great pick for our family. Other reviews said this was in a "bad district". DON'T BE FOOLED!! It's a great district. It's between some business headquarters. The outsid of the building wasn't fancy, but the inside was BEAUTIFUL!!! Lots of art and a big sitting area in the lobby.This was on the outskirts of town, but literally right next to the Blue line station for the El Train, which goes to O'Hare and downtown. The rooms are quiet and you can't hear the El unless you are really listening for them. Staff was very helpful and polite. When we requested more towels,they were brought to our room almost immediately. The room was immaculate, by far the cleanest hotel room I've stayed in! All rooms are suites.The pool was nice and warm, but the trip back up was cold, so if you're going to the pool, bring some extra towels or coverups. I also loved the parking garage. Hassle free and it's connected to the building. Taking the bridge over the freeway, across the street are restruants and a grocery store. There is an restruant in the hotel, but we wanted something less fancy. Note-If you want to get an all day El pass, you have to buy it at the grocery store across the street. Great stay and hope to return soon!!

Reviews.Title: “A business traveler's dream”
Reviews.Author: Derkleiner
Reviews.Content: This is my first choice as a Marriott platinum elite member when traveling in Chicago. Located on the blue line near O'Hare, the price is always very competitive and the rooms are well appointed for business travel. Although they offer a great shuttle service to and from O'Hare, I choose to take the blue line as it stops in the parking lot of the hotel. Check out this property the next time you are in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Unique property w/ large comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Supermagictasticguy
Reviews.Content: This is a large property spaced near many office buildings in the vicinity but not next door to the airport. Rooms have a living area next to the bedroom and bath. All rooms have doors for privacy. HDTVs are small, but had a great channel selection. TVs are in bedroom and living area. There is a small fridge in the living area. Shower is huge and very nice. Starbucks in on the lobby level. Rooms are quiet and on-site restaurant was good for dinner. One item of criticism. Upon checking out I requested to use Marriott gift-cards to pay for my stay. The check-out person said that it would "take 15 minutes" to process. It did not take that long and I could not help but sense that they simply used that line as a ploy to not have to take the extra steps to process the gift cards. Its an isolated incident that just was poor customer service. It did not ruin the stay, this is a property worthy of many repeat visits.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Abrndale
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Rennaissance several times. On the last visit had something drop behind a cabinet. Had to move the cabinet to get my belongings and it was filthy behind the cabinet. Looked like it had never been moved since the hotel was built. Lots of trash, dirt noted behind the cabinet. Mentioned it to the front desk clerk who blew it off. Otherwise the hotel is nice with close proximity to the blue line. Getting in and out of parking garage was a challenge as the gates were never working correctly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice king-size suite, quiet and well appointed. Good concierge lounge.”
Reviews.Author: girlcats
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not conveniently located to walk to much in the way of amenities e.g. restaurants, but if you are a platinum member you'll enjoy a nice concierge lounge. Although not terribly large it's well maintained and the food is great. The woman who runs the lounge 6 days a week from open to close keeps it clean and the food well stocked. I had a king-size suite that had a beautiful bathroom which could be entered off of both the living area and the bedroom. The room included a decent size refrigerator, which is always a plus. Overall the room was comfortable, clean and very quiet. I'll stay at this hotel again if I find myself on a business trip in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: travelgoo
Reviews.Content: This place is nice. The lobby was beautiful over Christmas. The room is spacious enough (not very big for a suite), the bathroom was very nice, and the bed was very, very comfortable. The room was quiet enough even though its by the airport. The only two downsides are the parking ($20 per night seems absurd and hurtful when they offer park and fly with free parking). And the food at the "fresh" restaurant was not good. Maybe that's why it was totally dead. The breakfast we had delivered via room service included two omlets and two glasses of juice. 60 bucks. No kidding. And that didn't even include the extra tip I added. They were good, but no better than dennys. And the juice was 6 bucks for a 6oz glass. i doubt it was even fresh squeezed, but even if it was, that price is too high. We didn't pay attention to the prices but I guess we should have. My wife got sick about 4 hours after eating this omlet. Not sure if it was the omlet, but it very well could have been. I went back for lunch and had a steak sandwich. It was not fresh tasting at all. The meat was acceptable, but barely. It tasted like it was on the verge of being spoiled. I ate it anyway, even though I should have sent it back. And they only have email in the room if you pay 10 bucks a day. This is too often the standard at nicer places, but seems silly and greedy given the ubiquity of free internet everywhere. The food (and parking) here needs a major adjustment. Even though I paid only 79 bucks for a 4 star hotel, I felt the whole experience was just "good."

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for overnight at ORD”
Reviews.Author: Roy O
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before catching a morning flight to Calgary, B.C. and used their covered parking for 10 days. Shuttle service was prompt and courteous. Beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for hotel close to O'Hare”
Reviews.Author: travelisphun
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay. We stayed here over the Thanksgiving weekend. The hotel offers the amenities of a full service hotel but the feel of a small boutique hotel. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. We got a microwave put in our room upon request. Downside is the room does not have a kitchen with dishes. The hotel is very quiet considering its proximity to the airport and a major highway leading to the airport. The suite offers more space than a typical hotel room and the bed was very comfortable and the room itself was clean and in good condition. The restaurant is quite good. For breakfast they offer a buffet with a chef making waffles, omelettes, etc. to order 7 days a week. We stayed on the Concierge level and the breakfast was complementary as the Concierge lounge was closed the weekend we were there. The hotel offers a nice pool, whirlpool and exercise room. Typical for full service hotels by the airport, you do pay for parking, internet access and the business center. However, if you want to travel to downtown Chcago by rapid transit, this hotel is ideally located close to one of the rapid transit stops. But in the wintertime it may be more comfortable to take the hotel shuttle to the airport to catch the rapid transit inside the airport than to walk the couple of blocks to the nearby rapid transit stop. This hotel is a great choice if you want to have good access to the O'Hare airport and downtown Chicago with clean, comfortable, spacious accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for an overnight at ORD”
Reviews.Author: Bethany_Dude
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on my way to Europe a couple of weeks ago. Got a good night sleep in a nice updated hotel which is what I was looking for. Concierge level is a little small but not bad. Service was excellent. If I need to do an overnight at ORD this will be my hotel in the future. I had the room with a wall between the bedroom and the living room. The TV in the bedroom was small (about 22") while the TV in the living room is about 32". On my way out I looked in a room that did not have the walled off bedroom and it looked like it had a single 32" TV that was on a swivel for both the living room and bedroom. I think I would prefer this type of room for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, Convenient Hotel with Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MillionMilr
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying in a Marriot Renaissance Hotel; and, this will not be the last time. This hotel is outstanding - great location only minutes east of O'Hare airport from the main airport exit, directly off the Kennedy Expressway. The hotel is located next to the Chicago L Cumberland station (about a 1 minute walk). This is extremely convenient to take the L Train into the city instead of fighting the Chicago traffice. I was a Gold member so they offered a lot of convenient perks for Marriott Gold and Platinum Rewards members. The conceirge lounge is wonderful. although the lounge is only open on weekdays. Despite the lounge being closed on weekends, the hotel allows Conceirge floor guests to have free breakfast in the restaurant and free evening appetizers in the lobby bar when the lounge is closed. I have never seen this benefit before when the lounge is closed. The Conceirge lounge is also located on a key-only access floor - providing utmost privacy and security. During the one day we could use the lounge, they had a very savory dinner along with chocolate chip cookies and desserts. It was nice the lounge had complementary bottles of Evian water I could take to my room. My only complaints are the following: 1) Payying $20 for daily parking :( and 2) There is only wired internet access in the rooms - no WiFi. I thought all hotels had inroom WiFi these days. This hotel only seems to have WiFi set up in their restaurant and lobby areas. The rooms are two room suites with two TVs and sofa-bed which is convenient when traveling with a family. I requested a room overlooking the airport which was nice to see planes landing and taking off. Staff is also very friendly - prompt attention to extra pillow and blanket requests. This is by far one of my favorite Marriotts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: draeco420
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel, they have great service and easy access to the blue line train,it's at the end of the parking lot along a well lighted walkway, which is a plus. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpfull. The rooms were very spacious, clean and comfortable, with large clean bathrooms. They have a small variety of sandwiches, snacks and drinks in the lobby which is great for late night munching. Also being so close to the airport, we did not really have any complaints about the noise, it was actually fairly quiet. All in all this is a great hotel if your staying in the chicago area.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Both Worlds”
Reviews.Author: Eurotripper
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to O Hare and there is a train station nearly connected to the hotel. Here you can take the train straight to downtown Chicago to the heart of everything in about 35 minutes. The hotel has a Starbucks in the lobby but you dont even need it because there are coffee makers in the rooms, airport shuttle and snack shop in the hotel. The hotel was clean with excellent amenities and exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Fine airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: jack783
Reviews.Content: This airport hotel is about ten minutes from O'Hare, just off the highway. The shuttle leaves from the airport and the hotel every half hour, 24 hours a day and both times I took it, it was right on time. I found the service to be excellent and they handled requests courteously and promptly. My room was a true suite, with a bedroom door that closes and a bathroom that had two doors--one to the bedroom and another to the living room. There was a small fridge along with a coffee maker and a room safe. Internet was around $10 a night but free for Platinum and above. There is a 24 hour pantry next to reception. I had no issues with lines at reception, thin walls, or other common problems, so maybe it was my lucky day. The workout facilities are better than I have seen in many other airport hotels, with a good workout room, an indoor pool where you can actually swim laps, a good sized hot tub next to the pool, and a sauna in the bathroom. The hotel is located next to the highway and I got some traffic noise from the bedroom but not the living room, so I guess it depends on the windows in your room. The way the hotel is situated it's hard to avoid the noise but it wasn't too bad unless you're sensitive. It's a 5-10 minute walk to the train that takes you to O'Hare (two stops) or downtown Chicago (40 minutes). It would be a tough walk in bad weather but fine in pleasant weather. I got a great rate through Expedia courtesy of Trip Advisor, much better than the hotel's own website.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you donÂ´t mind to take train to Downtown. Good Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: eroare
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 2 times in this hotel and i really like it, in order downtown hotels are crazy expensive this is a good choice if you donÂ´t mind to take the train 40 minutes to downtown Chicago, a walk bridge communicates the hotel parking and the train. The rooms are really good and spacious, it has sofabed and it really works good when you come with a family (stay of 4 or 5 people). the bathrooom is nice and spacious too. the Hotel looks new but the only lacking is the internet charged in the rooms, nowadays internet should not be considered an extra service, it should be a really need and being provided !!!!. the stuff are really kind, the best of the hotel i think is the shuttle service for pick up and going to the airport, is really quickly !, the bar is good but it closes early. overall a good experience and i will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Park/Sleep/Fly deal at the Renaissance O'Hare”
Reviews.Author: mbinbbg
Reviews.Content: We were flying out of O'Hare on a Monday morning and needed to park our car for the full extent of our Hawaii vacation. ParkSleepFly.com provided the perfect solution. We got an incredible deal on a one-night stay at the lovely 4-star Renaissance at O'Hare and left our car in their parking garage, protected and sheltered. We were absolutely pleased. The Renaissance is a great place to stay and their restaurant, Fresh, was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Except for the location, it is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LyndaMN
Reviews.Content: Three adult family members stayed in the Renaissance O'Hare for three nights. Our activities centered around downtown Chicago but we stayed at the Renaissance because it was SO much cheaper than staying downtown. Comparable hotels downtown were $229 a night and we paid $109 at the Ren. We bought a $14 three-day El pass and used the heck out of it. The Blue line is just about a block from the hotel - even my 82 yr old mother could handle that. Once on the blue line, it is a straight shot to the center of downtown and takes 30 - 40 minutes. Everything about the Renaissance was great with one exception. The sofa bed mattress was horrible. I really REALLY mean horrible. Perhaps if you had two small kids sleeping on it, it wouldn't be an issue but for an adult, it was very uncomfortable. The other two beds were very comfortable. The room was clean, the bathroom was roomy and the decorations were attractive. The hotel bar, which is the 'restuarant' at night, offered a limited menu and the music was too loud. Since the hotel is pretty much isolated and on an expressway, it was nice to have a place to grab a bite in the late evening. There is a Starbucks in the lobby serving pastry and coffee until about 5 pm. Internet is available in the room (wired) for about $10 and wireless is free in the hotel lobby. This was my third time staying at the Renaissance and while I don't really like having to take the train downtown each day, I don't like paying 'downtown prices' even more. The hotel seemed to be filled with guests yet it was very quiet, which we loved. I was afraid, with so many guests in the common areas, that it would be noisy at night but we didn't hear a peep. Our TV went out one evening and I called the front desk and a maintenance man was at our door in about 5 minutes. Great service!! THere is a shuttle bus to and from the airport, too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - almost excellent”
Reviews.Author: slscottxny
Reviews.Content: For the price a great option. Rooms are spacious, clean and well decorated. Very comfortable bedding. Service was friendly albeit a bit amateurish especially when discussing restaurant options. The shuttle service not only takes to and from the aiport but also was availalbe to take us back and forth from local restaurants, saves a lot on cab fare! My only complaint, which is a pet peeve of mine, no free wi-fi in the rooms - only in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Nice OHare hotel option”
Reviews.Author: bergcarrie
Reviews.Content: This is a really decent hotel for the price. The rooms are very nicely sized (I had a king suite). The bed was very comfortable, it was quiet, bathroom was fantastic because it had a ton of room and a large shower, and it had a nice sized desk. Room downfalls: no wireless internet, and a small closet that was difficult to get to because it was behind the main bedroom door. Fitness facility and pool area are very nice. The restaurant is fantastic. Normally, I would tell you to run from any place that suggests a buffet, but the lunch buffet during the week is redonkulous. I mean,,,,it was seriously good stuff. It is a benefit that this is a good place to eat, because there is not much else nearby, other then the Bar Louis in the Holiday Inn across the main highway (this was very good too). Huge advantage to this hotel: you are a hop, skip, and a jump from the blue line el to take you downtown, for a whopping $2.25. And, they have a hotel shuttle service to ORD.

Reviews.Title: “Staff so good!”
Reviews.Author: conor40
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight with my wife and three kids on route to Texas from Ireland. Room was great, though the sofa bed not brilliant! We asked at reception about any local restaurants, the girls nearly came to blows over which pizzeria each wanted us to dine in! The hotel shuttle bus dropped and collected us too, which was great. On our way back from Texas we had a ten hour wait for our connection home. I called the hotel to see if they could look after our luggage while we went into the city. No problem at all! The staff, from the shuttle bus driver to the household and front desk staff, are a credit to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: muwarrior_94
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for couples or families who wish to either "sleep & park" or travel on to Chicago. Very conveniently located by O'Hare with flight information prominently located in the lobby. Also, the El is within walking distance to easily get downtown. The rooms were spacious & the beds were comfortable. We weren't here with the children but definitely would bring the family... nice refrigerator in the room and a true suite with a separate bedroom/ living space. The hotel was quiet, nice bar & restaurant. The beds were comfortable, spacious walk in shower, Aveda products, etc, etc. Wonderful place & reasonably priced when utilizing an online deal. We'll definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: KinganI
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed here on a "sleep and park" deal for an early flight out of O'Hare. For a very reasonable rate, we stayed and left our car in their parking ramp while we were gone. They have a shuttle to take you to the airport and pick you up when you return. Everything exceeded our expectations. The room was lovely. Service was excellent. It was a wonderful way to begin our trip. We would definitely do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Overlooks the smaller details”
Reviews.Author: Rosebriar2
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Renaissance Chicago O'Hare on business, as we were attending a conference there. The room was clean and relatively spacious, but lacked many simple things, like a pad of paper, information about the hotel's amenities, a mirror with sufficient lighting to put on makeup, an envelope to use for tipping housekeeping, etc. I was disappointed that a Marriott hotel (which I usually enjoy) was so lacking in the basics. On the plus side, the conference space was decent. Ultimately, I would not stay here on my own dime. It's convenient if you're just staying the night for a conference at the hotel, but isn't convenient for driving or walking to anything nearby (because there isn't anything nearby) and lacks the small details that make traveling easier.

Reviews.Title: “My First Renaissance Experience”
Reviews.Author: JohnCWang1688
Reviews.Content: As the higher brand of the Marriott family, I have to say I am somewhat disappointed with the overall experience. It is a good hotel, just lack of details for attention. For example, their front door was closed due to repair, so if you are taking their free airport shuttle, they drop you off the parking lot next office building. Although it is very close, but there are few steps to take, an issue if you have kids and bags, and no bell person to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: CCRR
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early in the morning from an overnight flight. The free shuttle arrived quickly after calling the hotel. The shuttle driver was friendly and professional. The front desk staff were courteous and our room was ready when we got there! The room was clean, comfortable and spacious. They had the extra pillows on the bed that I had requested. The location next to the subway is super convenient. This hotel, without a doubt, would be our first choice for a return trip to O'Hare. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: denjan1
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very comfortable and large. The bar is dark and cozy with good food and good service, we enjoyed chatting with Amy at the bar. Good value and good price.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Dime you”
Reviews.Author: Hellas80
Reviews.Content: $20+/night for parking for hotel guests, $10/day for internet... and it's not wifi, it's a hardwire that comes out of the desk. On top of that, mold in the shower and the bathroom door was falling off the wall. I've stayed here twice before, but it's time to stay elsewhere. Renaissance is in the top 3 of Marriott hotels ranking.... I would excpect a little better accomodation from this place. I did not stay here for access to the airport, I needed suburb and downtown access... so locationwise it's not bad, but it could be more accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay near Airport for a workout”
Reviews.Author: UDbill
Reviews.Content: This hotel has comfortable, large rooms. It has a nice contemporary lobby and it has a great Fitness area and pool. Just stayed here and had a great workout and a great swim. While the pool is not 25 meters it is at least 16. I am sure it is the largest lap swim pool near Ohare. I have a race this weekend and their facilities came in handy. Staff was also very nice and helpful. Not too far from the airport and a good room rate as well.

Reviews.Title: “Booked to stay again”
Reviews.Author: jerlea
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel. I booked the reservation via the Park/Sleep/Fly. The room was large and very clean. The parking garage was a very safe place to leave our car for the two weeks we were gone. Shuttle service to and from the airport is reliable. We will be staying at the hotel again in October when we leave on another trip.

Reviews.Title: “A great Park/Sleep/Fly hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl37743
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel through the Park/Sleep/Fly web site 2 or 3 months before our trip. You can leave your car there for 14 days if you stay there the night before your trip, the night after your trip or both. We chose to stay both before and after and had a rate of $99 each night plus $30.49 for taxes and $4.99 transaction fee (this is nonrefundable). Normally if you stay at this hotel you are charged $20 a day for parking so this package is really a good deal and the room is clean, modern, and very upscale. They offer 24 hour shuttle service to the airport which was one of our requirements because we didn't get back to Chicago from our trip until 1:00 in the morning. The bed was comfortable and it had a large glass step-in shower. I would definitely use this hotel and the Park/Sleep/Fly package again. As it was getting closer to the day we left I checked the website to see if the fares had changed and this package was more expensive so it pays to book early.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport with spacious and quiet rooms!”
Reviews.Author: aibtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. The hotel is incredibly close to O'hare but pretty far form everything else. It is also very quiet for being so close to a major airport. Check-in was a breeze despite the fact that we came in close to 2 am. Our hotel room was nice--spacious with all the amenities (safe, refrigerator, hair dryer, coffee maker, etc) and a large separate seating area. Though the room was a bit dated, it was very clean and the bathroom was huge! I would say the bathroom seemed more up to date than the room. The bed was really comfortable, with large down comforters and goose-down filled Euro shams and pillows. The hotel has a Starbucks, which was nice to grab a cup of coffee in the mornings. We paid around $84+taxes per night (around $97 per night). Honestly, the biggest con was the parking. Parking costs $15 per day and $20 per night. We wanted to stay at a hotel that was in the $80 range and had we known about the parking, we would not have stayed here. With taxes, we paid close to $120 per night. Our stay was definitely NOT worth that much. Another negative was that internet access was $9.95 per day. I am used to staying at hotels with free wifi. The other issue we had was that housekeeping came to clean our room at 9 am on a Saturday morning. I am assuming most people who stay at this hotel are traveling on business, but to come into our room that early on Saturday morning was a bit weird in my opinion. Other than these minor complaints, I would recommend staying at this hotel if you do not mind paying a lot for parking and if you need to stay near the O'hare airport area.

Reviews.Title: “Enter parking from rear, off Bryn Mawr continues Delphia (street name)”
Reviews.Author: Midwestern_Woman
Reviews.Content: Website and confirmation emails did NOT tell that front parking garage entrance is closed due to construction. There is a "temporary entrance" sign pointing the way to the current back entrance to parking garage; even on weekend, a hotel employee was always stationed at that back entrance to answer questions and point out the current entrance. Hotel and Starbucks employees (even with limited weekend hours) helpful. Bed seemed new, sheets good quality and comfortable. Temperature hard to adjust since gauge is on side wall by living room TV. Needs some updating or additions: no coffee mugs or plates despite having frig and box of coffee/tea and small brewer; microwave would be helpful; wood veneer bubbling off bathroom counter front. Annoying nickel and dimeing: business center, must pay to use any computer as well as in-room internet. Snooty Renaissance attitude silly, when many O'Hare area hotels offer it free for a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: cherylwalt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the opportunity to go to Chicago to see a Cubs game. We were only going for a short time, so we decided to stay near the airport. We made the right decision. From the moment we were greeted at the airport by our shuttle driver to the time we were taken back to the airport, this hotel left a great impression. The hotel itself is lovely and beautifully decorated in a modenistic theme. The initial impression of the hotel is made when you walk through the doors to a beautiful lobby, but that is not the only impression you will get of this hotel, they have a first rate staff! The staff is truly "at your service" and is willing to help you as much as they can and I mean the ENTIRE staff. The Renaissance did a great job in staffing their hotel, what a lovely group of people.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, with terrifice Park and Fly arrangements”
Reviews.Author: khoheisel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with Park and Fly. Perfect shuttle timing coming and going. Clean and quiet- in spite of being in glide path of aircraft to O'Hare. Gigantic pool in basement.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelTops
Reviews.Content: I spent one night for business in September and was very pleased with my stay. The hotel is minutes from the outskirts of Chicago O'hare with easy (almost right at hand) access to the commuter rail for travel into downtown or the airport if desired. The Property shows very nicely and is exceptionally clean. The staff was uniformly attentive and expert in all my questions and needs. As an all suites hotel, I really enjoyed the room. Very clean and contemporary. I like the separation of bedroom and living areas...makes it feel quite roomy. The materials were all very nice with granite in the bathroom and nice LCD tvs in both the bedroom and living room... The only change that I would recommend is adding wifi in the rooms...nowadays this seems like it should be a given, especially in a quality Marriott brand like Renaissance... Nevertheless this is a minor point and I would not hesitate to stay for business again and plan to...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Close to the airport, far from downtown.”
Reviews.Author: JulianM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for just one night and everything was great. Awesome room, good staff, shuttle to/from the airport, very close to the train station, nice food, etc. Internet is 9.95 per day, but at least you get high-speed. The train ride downtown was very long, probably around 50 minutes, so this hotel might not be the best option for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Normal Guy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend getaway 08/26-28/2011. Check-in was very quick and easy, and I was on my way to my suite in probably 90 seconds. The rooms here are true suites....separate living room and bedroom. The rooms weren't huge, but plenty big enough for 2, or even 3 people. The refrigerator is always a nice touch, especially when staying more than just one night. Only have a couple of complaints about the room. The decor is dated, and not very pleasant. The carpet had a rip in it, although the rest of the flooring was clean and in good repair. The remote didn't work on the TV in the living room, and if that had bothered me too much, I would have contacted the desk. As other people have noted, the hotel is VERY quiet, especially being located near the airport and on the expressway. The CTA stop on the Blue Line couldn't be any more convenient, and is really the best way to get downtown. I paid $81.75 plus tax, and $20 per day for parking. Not bad for a suite near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful and quiet”
Reviews.Author: jim_from_sf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after flying into O'Hare. We took the hotel shuttle from the airport to the hotel, but it is only 2 stops down the Blue line L from the airport, and that would be much faster than the 1 hour wait for the shuttle (my only complaint about the hotel service). The check-in process was very smooth, and though the hotel restaurant is very pricey, the bar has some great food as well at lower prices. The pizza there was really good (though my standards are likely lower than Chicagoans). I was worried about the fact that the hotel is directly under the airport flight path and next to a busy freeway, but it was completely silent in the room -- it is a well-constructed building. The room itself was spacious, bright and very comfortable. There were two HD flat-screen TVs, and an enormous bathroom and shower. There is a good fitness center and an indoor pool/spa. We were never able to use the pool or spa because of its limited hours, and every time we went to the area, there were many kids there -- our stay was during school holidays. Getting into the city was easy on the train. It is literally steps away from the train station which takes you straight to the loop. It was even easier getting to the airport. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody looking for good value near to the airport with easy access to the city. Far cheaper than staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great property despite the mishaps”
Reviews.Author: TravelFanSFBayArea
Reviews.Content: I was here on a business trip and enjoyed the location (close to airport) and the facilities: great conference rooms, great conference support staff, nice and roomy suites, a Starbucks, an indoor pool and a fitness center, what more can you ask for? The only issue I found was upon checkout, when despite the fact that I had requested late checkout the cleaning staff came by and removed all my sheets, towels etc and in the rush (I caught them as they were cleaning up my room) my brand new sunglasses and a bracelet mysterously disappeared. I called three days in a row to get the staff to find my items, but never got one phone call back, so that was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Too Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: Make sure that you don't stay on the side of the hotel that faces the Kennedy Expressway. You won't sleep well due to the traffic noise and the noise from the "L" Train. They need different windows or something on that side. Stayed 2 nights and didn't get decent sllep either night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sara9889
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very large, with a separate sitting area. Very comfortable bed. The hotel is very nicely decorated in the rooms and lobby area. We had a nice dinner at the restaurant, and enjoyed Starbuck's on the ground floor. This hotel is close to the elevated train, for quick trips to the city and to the airport. They do not have wireless in the rooms, but it is available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: charli3601
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short conference that was being held in the hotel. Check in was smooth but my colleague received a better room than I did although I have Marriott platinum status and she is a general member of Marriott Rewards. Although puzzling, this was no big deal as it was a short trip. The rooms were fine, with separate bedrooms and living rooms. It did not appear there was much to walk to, except maybe a subway station that would take you into town. The weather was lousy the entire stay so we did not attempt any sight seeing. There were nice restaurants within a quick drive and after some back and forth the hotel agreed to take a group of us, via its shuttle, to a restaurant a pick us up later. I prefer to stay downtown when in Chicago but if I needed to stay close to O'Hare I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing - what a rude staff”
Reviews.Author: travelmomIndiana
Reviews.Content: The majority of the staff members treated us rudely. They were smug and condescending. The front entrance is closed due to construction, so we were on our own with absolutely no help. They don't seem to understand that they are there to serve their guests - we were merely an inconvenience to them. They must not be able to see all of the other hotels that people can choose from in the area. Don't pay this amount of money to be treated this poorly.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced, we won't go back.”
Reviews.Author: RFR_10
Reviews.Content: The room was okay, nothing special. It seemed fairly clean but our trash was not taken out for the three nights we were there. Parking and internet were additional charges. This hotel is definitely over-priced. If you book yourself on-line, make sure to call the hotel and confirm the price. We were charged significantly more than the website quote. A high school marching band was staying/practicing in the hotel while were were there.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect solution for an early morning flight.”
Reviews.Author: BXC53
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night prior to flying out the next morning. The Renaissance was great! Helpful staff, great beds and bath facilities. The room was not large, but it fit my needs perfectly. I really liked the access to the "L" train station next door. We rode it into downtown the evening before our departure for dinner and a little 'R&R" in the Loop area. We wouldn't have done it if we had to deal with traffic and parking in our rental car. In fact we dropped the car off a day early and took the hotel shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - will stay again”
Reviews.Author: lncooper529
Reviews.Content: we brought our church youth group here aug 2-7th, a group of 35. the hotel did a great job accomidating all of us and all of our needs. the hotel had issues with flooding the wk before so the pool was out and the gym was also. those were obviously things that no one could control but the hotel did partner with a gym across the street that allowed all hotel guest to use their facility, which was great. there are no connecting rooms, but they do provide a shuttle to the airport, parking isnt free, but no hotel in chicago is. we were treated greatly and will return when we come to the chicago area!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel to Blue Line”
Reviews.Author: Sumrdream
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the convenience to the Blue Line train to get downtown. We came for a concert and did not want to rent a car, and this hotel's location was perfect as the subway station is across the parking lot. The hotel was nice and clean, the room although a suite, was compact. The walk in shower was amazing! Front desk gave us wrong directions on how to get to the subway station and we walked around for 15 minutes before finding someone else to give us directions. Nice hotel, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall greatness - thank you!”
Reviews.Author: ThePBR
Reviews.Content: The Fresh restaurant at the hotel was phenominal - great food (wonderful tomato basil soup!), quality service, truly met our needs. We had lunch and ended up returning for dinner for fantasic seafood entrees. Hotel staff is professional and helpful. Rooms were clean and extra comfortable beds. Workout room was clean, well kept, and easy access.

Reviews.Title: “quality stay overall”
Reviews.Author: WebBrown
Reviews.Content: The room itself is difficult to rate. The bathroom was newly renovated with a huge shower, tile, granite, etc. The living roo had cheap wood furniture, a carpet that had seen better days, and a creaky older couch. The bedroom was somewhere between the other two rooms in terms of quality. The mattress was fine. The bedroom is a bit on the small side. The hotel restaurant is wonderful for breakfast. It is cooked to order and delicious. Even better than Embassy suites in my opinion. And the service in the restaurant is outstanding. Overall I would stay here again if the price was right. One big recommendation to Renaissance O'Hare is to please put some trashcans in common areas such as the lobby. It is annoying having to take trash back to your room or give it to the front desk to throw out if you have a coke in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Part of SleepParkFly”
Reviews.Author: debbienussbaum
Reviews.Content: This program was recommended by my travel agent and she recommended THIS hotel. The hotel was fabulous and we were sorry that we hadn't gotten there earlier. We were so pleased that we called our daughter, who was traveling the following week, and recommended that she do the same. Everything was perfect until we returned. As instructed, we called for pick up by the shuttle as soon as we got through customs. It took 45 minutes to get picked up which was very disheartening after a long airline flight. The driver was extremely pleasant (I wish we would have gotten his name to compliment him). When we pulled up to the hotel and saw 4 empty vans, many of us questioned what was going on. The driver explained that the next driver came on duty at 4pm. Doesn't the Renaissance management realize that Chicago rush hour starts at 3pm? For our driver to still be pleasant after putting up with rush hour traffic, airport traffic, irrate travelers, overstuffed luggage, and no help, he should be nominated for sainthood! Come on, Renaissance, you should have more than one van operating on a Friday afternoon!

Reviews.Title: “your average 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: KS66212
Reviews.Content: I read some not so good reviews about this hotel, but could not resist the price deal that I got. So, I decided to stay there for my Chicago trip (4 nights) and I am glad that I did. The hotel is very clean, the room was spacious it felt like a studio appartment. It had a good refegirator but no micorwave. House keeping showed up everyday. Front desk staff were helpful and friendly. Free wireless internet in the lobby and $10 for in-room wired internet Parking is attached to the hotel so no walking involved. Easy in and easy out. If you prefer to take the train (the L blue line), the Cumberland circle station is right next to the hotel (2 minute walk). I would stay there again, no doubt about it.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the hype”
Reviews.Author: lance99c
Reviews.Content: I was not pleased with my stay at this hotel. I was headed to Chicago for a family athering and needed a hotel for myself and my 20 yr. old daughter. When I had booked, I had asked for a room with 2 double beds. I was given a room with 1 King sized bed. When I checked in, I asked at the front desk for a room with 2 double beds. The clerk said that one was available and registered me for that room. I arrived at the room and there was 1 King sized bed. I went down to the front desk to ask about the 2 double beds. The clerk then looked at her computer screen and said sorry wedon't have any doubles available. Why didn't she know this 5 minutes before when I checked in and she gave me the room key? She says that there is a pull out couch in the room, so I figured that this was the best that I could do. When I returned to the room at the end of the night, I opened the pull out couch and found that there were no sheets on the couch. Looked in the closet and drawers, no sheets. For $120/night I figured you'd at least put sheets on the bed. Also, not happy with the $20/night parking. If this was downtown Chicago where space is at a premium, I could understand but in an office park by the airport, this is just gouging guests that have no other choice but to pay it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Modern”
Reviews.Author: cgarn
Reviews.Content: We had to stay over in Chicago because our flight was cancelled. We luck out and got the Renaissance. The service was very good and when I had to request anything (such as towels), it was brought up immediately. Having a Starbucks inside the hotel as well as a board showing the flights out of O'Hare was excellent. The hotel was very clean and modern. The shuttle to the hotel also stopped for us when I wave them down as they were leaving O'Hare. Thank goodness since I was dragging my 2 little girls with me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Texastraveler091
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific airport hotel. All of the amenities of a typical airport hotel, but in a very spacious, clean and inviting setting. Breakfast was great, there is a Starbucks on site and the rooms are very spacious, well appointed and extremely clean. Within 100 yards of a Blue Line stop and an easy cab/train ride into the city. 4 Star value as well.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service rocks here”
Reviews.Author: AngelaMBrooks
Reviews.Content: I arrived late after a really long day of flying - When I walked in the lady ask if she could do anything for me to make my stay better after the day I had - all I wanted to do was sleep. The room was big - and super clean. The couch had a stain on one pillow, that I moved and set on the floor. From the house keeper who worked on that hall to the people at the front counter the customer was great. I ate two meals in the "Fresh Dining" and the servers were super. I never had to ask for a refill - or for a finished plate to be removed. Room Service has the fun-ist guys delivering breakfast ! Smiling and friendly. The 2nd morning when breakfast was 15 mins late arriving - he smiled and said enjoy it is on us we are so sorry. The only down thing I experienced - I could not use their internet.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck at O'Hare”
Reviews.Author: boyanddog
Reviews.Content: This was a stay that was dictated by the airline. Given the long line of stranded travelers they did an amazing job of getting us checked in and the bar kept the kitchen open an extra 2 hours to accommodate us. The staff was stellar!

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnight”
Reviews.Author: tnshsms
Reviews.Content: We were stranded in Chicago due to weather and had to stay overnight. They had a room left so we stayed here. Rooms were spacious and nice. Very clean. Food was a little pricey but it was hotel food...they are all a little pricey. My pasta was $12 and the salad was 8 I think. We could have shared both. Staff was nice but not overly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StephanieRose
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend visiting friends in the area. Our room was on the 16th floor and we found it to be very spacious and comfortable. The room was quiet and bed was comfortable. We didn't dine or have cocktails on the property but heard it was pretty good. We did appreciate the Starbucks in the lobby! Blue line stop is very close to the property for convinient access into downtown. The shuttle from ORD seems a bit slow and we felt that other hotel properties came every 15 mins versus the 30 mins for Renaissance. The location is great for any travelers to ORD. The property felt like it was more oriented in a buisneness neighborhood and didn't seem to have dining nearby-maybe a cheap cab hire though.

Reviews.Title: “clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: alysinforman
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights with my boyfriend. The room was bigger than expected and extremely clean! The living area was lovely but the in room coffee was gross. Luckily, there is a starbucks in the lobby. The first night we were there we hung out at the bar. It was pricey but good. Both nights we slept better than ever! Breakfast is crazy expensive so I would suggest getting a coffee and muffin at the starbucks instead. We took the train into the city and it was super convenient! I had called ahead to ask how far away the blue line stop was and they told me it was a block away. It was actually in the parking lot. I will be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “stingy luxury”
Reviews.Author: momwithcollegekids
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to pay for food. The restauant/bar is very pricey for families with teens. No wi-fi in the rooms. There are charges for connections. One small bottle of shampoo provided. Charges for bottle of water in room. Charges for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Why does this place have a 4 star rating?”
Reviews.Author: teamfdn
Reviews.Content: This place is advertised as a 4 star hotel but in reality it is 2.5 - 3 stars at best. And that's on a good day when they don't have their usual rotation of extraordinarily rude staff working. I don't even know where to start to be honest so I'll try to take this from the beginning. This place is next to impossible to find. Check in was a nightmare. There was only one person working the front desk during peak hours and I stood there for 20 minutes while the person at the desk carried on a personal conversation on the work phone and never once had the courtesy to say something simple like "I will be with you in a moment". I was interrogated on a rather confrontational level when I requested an extra room key for my girlfriend. So we finally get to the room and housekeeping has not only forgotten to give us any bath towels, but I once again get interrogated when I request additional bath towels, which technically were not extra since there were none in the room to begin with. The website also falsely advertises the beds as comfortable but they are actually very uncomfortable and later on we noticed that we had strange insect bites on us. Looked like bed bugs. Disgusting. The TV's in the "suite" were antiques. Very very small antiques at that. The room smelled of cigarettes and the window had been left open in the middle of winter with the heat off. Does nobody inspect these rooms after housekeeping attempts to claim that they've cleaned them? Upon checkout we learn that we've also been robbed for an additional $40 in parking fees. This is more than a lot of places inside the city charge for parking, however, this hotel is not in the city. It's in the middle of nowhere. The worst part of all though was the insect bites that we suspect came from something that was living in the bed which obviously is not being cleaned properly. It's really too bad that an otherwise reputable chain of hotels has forever lost my business due to one location that no one seems to care about.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed with the second-tier room”
Reviews.Author: travellevret
Reviews.Content: Got stuck overnight and had a good stay before so picked this hotel with a airline discount voucher. The room was still pretty nice, but not nearly as nice as the Park and Fly room. I checked the website, but am not sure how to distinguish between the rooms--I'd like to know what I am getting when booking here. Overall, the hotel is clean and is a really good hotel. The shuttle is frequent, it is near the subway, and has a parking garage (though not cheap to park with daily rates). Internet access is free in the lobby, but not in rooms, which is a negative. For late arrivals, it would be nice if food-service was available later. The bar has pretty good food but closes at 10 or 11 PM and there is not a lot close if you do not have a car. The staff is friendly and efficient. For stranded travelers, they do offer toiletries. The lobby is large, and nicely decorated, but somehow sterile. Overall, this is a good place to stay near the airport, and a really good value. I do often recommend it for park and fly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice. Airport shuttle service has declined.”
Reviews.Author: TinaKay
Reviews.Content: Did a park & fly from this hotel for two years in a row. It was chosen for two reasons. (1) I saw their shuttle several times while waiting for Four Points shuttle in the past; and (2) all their parking is covered parking. The rooms are nice. The restaurant and bar have improved in the past year. The desk and wait staff were very nice. The shuttle drivers did their jobs. Most disappointing was the shuttle. When we tried to leave at 5am for the airport, there were over 20 other guests and all their luggage ready to go too. Yet they only ran ONE shuttle. One traveler asked the driver 3 times to to place his suitcase upright in the back, he would not do it. The guy took his suitcase to the already cramped seating area and set it in the aisle. The driver made a fuss about it being against regulation. They argued and eventtually the driver sat down and drove us to the airport. I was assured that the shuttle runs 24 hrs a day every 30 minutes. Last time they did. This time, when we returned to Ohare, we waited 20 minutes before calling to double check we were in the right place for pickup. We were. Then we waited another 45 minutes before the shuttle came. Another couple who boarded the bus said they had called and requested the shuttle come pick them up. If they hadn't showed up when they did, I was going to get a taxi. I was cold and frustrated. I saw the Holday Inn shuttle for the hotel across the street come around 3 times. Four Points two times. Double Tree 3 times. I'll probably be picking Holiday Inn or Double Tree next time whether they have covered parking or not. I REALLY dislike standing out in the cold after returning from a tropical vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: keb1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights while in the area for business. I would not have even known that this was an airport hotel - it was great! The staff was friendly, room service was prompt, and the club lounge had a good selection of both breakfast and evening appetizers. The only complaint that I have was that the bathroom was a little dark, but there was a full size mirror right outside of the bathroom where I did my makeup. Also, the fitness center was being renovated so the machines had been temporarily moved to a ballroom, and the tvs on the machines were not connected to the cable. I think the renovation is supposed to be complete in February 2011, so this will not be an issue anymore. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: amom4
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel with very comfortable beds . New looking and very clean. The location was great; it was a short walk to the blue line train. A dominink's food store was about half a mile away (across the transit bridge) I didn't like that there were no telephone books in the room. No information at all in the room about the area and so I had to keep calling the desk to ask about the area. The lobby had free wi-Fi internet but the room only had wired for $10 a day. There was a refrigator but no microwave. My room which had a king-sized bed only had a shower and no tub.. No washing machine in the whole hotel. It was very quiet. no plane or traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in and out of O'Hare”
Reviews.Author: Vissidarte
Reviews.Content: Booked through parksllepfly.com We were flying to and from Alaska and had good rate on Alaska Air. The parking is expensive otherwise, but parksleepfly saved us money and it worked fine..This hotel is so convenient to O'Hare but without the airplane noise.EXCELLENT shuttle service! Always available, courteous. We never had to wait at all and the drivers were great. The bonus was the large, spotless room- fly out night was in a one bedroom configuration and the back in night was a studio- we preferred the one bedroom. Huge, clean tiled shower, great mattress- everything CLEAN and I am picky. Front desk staff very courteous and helpful. You walk a short distance to the blue line and are downtown in 40 minutes with no driving and parking hassles- we watched the stopped traffic as the train whizzed by. Flying out of Chicago works for us for Europe or Alaska. We now have a consistent place to stay. Planning to meet daughter from Alaska here in May.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice. Close to blue line. Get the breakfast package.”
Reviews.Author: nikoli3
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 day stay with 4 adults and 2 small children. This hotel was great. We got a room with 2 double beds and a sleeper sofa. The beds and pillows were so soft and comfy and even the sofa bed was comfy. Nobody treated us any different for bringing in children. We added a breakfast package to the room for only $16 more and it was fantastic. Eggs, bacon, oatmeal, cold cereal, yogurt and a nice selection of fresh fruit. The best was the nice woman at the breakfast bar who would make a custom omelet. The service was great, the hotel was very nice, and it was a short walk to the blue line which will get you anywhere you need to go. The only downside was, there is no fast food joints around (mcdonalds or hardees for example) we drove around blindly for almost an hour before just deciding to go to the Dominicks grocery store down the road, which was a great place with a huge variety of food and drink. I do not think you would regret staying at this hotel, unless you just had to be closer to downtown. Oh it also had a really nice looking bar, but we did not utilize that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and beautiful suite, convenient to CTA.”
Reviews.Author: MtnTulips
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a business trip and this Renaissance hotel is very convenient to the airport (free shuttle, 24-7), and just a block from the train station to head into the city. If you don't mind taking the train, it takes about 30-40 min., but in terms of closeness to the airport, it's only about 10 minutes away. The suite was beautiful, and I was on the top floor (there is a lounge on the top floor with full breakfast buffet and happy hour that is free). I would definitely stay there again! The bed was very comfy (and the first thing I did was check for bed bugs, and not one in sight!) The pleasant surprise, was despite its closeness to the airport (and the planes, which you can see clearly), it was very quiet, and you really couldn't hear the planes or traffic at all. There is one day of complimentary broadband (no wireless in the rooms), so that is the only downside I can think of.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms and Good Dining Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Sherry022
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renassance Suites O'Hare on an overnight to Chicago. The room was spacious with a well appointed living area (small sofa, chair and really nice desk facing the seating area). The separate bedroom was nicely appointed with very comfortable bed and good pillows and linens. The marble bathroom was really nice with a very large glassed-in shower. The staff were friendly and the food in the hotel dining room was excellent. Even though it is close to the flight path, the hotel was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Wrigley Weekend”
Reviews.Author: CubsFanMichigan
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Chicago with a friend to catch a Cubs game. We originally made a reservation at the Marriott O' hare directly across from this hotel on the other side of the highway. We changed our reservation and stayed at the Renaissance instead since the Marriott had some construction going on within the pool/ whirlpool areas.The check in time was speedy and the front desk employees were all pleaseant and quite upbeat. The hotel has a very spacious, modern and inviting lobby area. Lots of leg room and some really comfortable sitting spots. Our room was unusually large in comparison to most hotels that I have stayed at within the same general area. The room was in very good and clean condition. The bed was very comfortable and the refrigerator in the room was a great addition to the ammenities and sure kept our beverages cold. The hotel has a really spacious swimming pool and a pretty nice whirlpool as well. My only complaint was the water temperature of the whirlpool was luke warm at best. I contacted the front desk and the temperature was much better later that day. It is nice to know that complaints and feedback do actually get taken care of quickly. Well anyways, this hotel is extremely convenient for travel to see a Cubs game. Wrigley Field is no more than 35 minutes away. The train station is less than a block away. It cost us $5 each for a pass to get us to and from the ballgame. The Bell Captain at the hotel gave us accurate diections by train and it turned out to be a great ballgame. Go Cubs!! I Make sure that you check out Ginos East for some super tasty Chicago style pizza. It is across the highway and maybe a 5 minute drive. My only complaints about this hotel would be as follows. The hotel is off a main road and there is no sign at the roadway itself. We drove right past it. There is a dark colored hotel sign at the actual entry. However, It is somewhat challenging to read and did not appear to be well lit. Unlike the other reviews, I expect and anticipate being charged to park my car at a hotel in the Chicago area. However, the parking structure is incredibly busy at times at the spaces are unusually narrow. Make sure that you are careful opening your doors. You don't want to hit the car next to you. I think that flat screen tv's would be a welcoming touch. Thats it, overall beutiful hotel and really nice time to be had. My first time at a Renaissance Hotel and I will absolutely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth the Distance”
Reviews.Author: GothamEthicsDoc
Reviews.Content: Three strengths: 1. Location, location, location - you don't need to pay 200 bucks more to stay downtown. Get off the plane, take the hotel shuttle, and then walk five minutes to the CTA station and enjoy a stress free ride downtown. 2. Rates. I could not believe it. Maybe it was a Friday night rate, but for a very comfortable room I got it for 109. Very sweet :). 3. Restaurant. "Fresh" buffet for lunch. 12 bucks. All good food - some prepared for you, other stuff nicely arranged and tasty. Three concerns: 1. I am a Platinum Marriott member. I have spent considerable money on achieving this level. Most properties thank me and tell me what amenities are offerred because of this level. 2. Resources. Parking: If you drive, it is a bit of a hassle not only finding a spot in the garage but the 20 bucks they make you pay! Internet: Why is there a high fee and whiy are the rooms not wireless? (the lobby is wireless and will cost you). 3. I think "more can be less," but there is a bit of an eeriness to the lack of visible staff around the property. I recognize there are plenty of cameras to prevent mishaps and violations, but i do think there is some need for more solicitous walking staff to be visible.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable suites near O'Hare”
Reviews.Author: Anecdotal
Reviews.Content: This Marriott property is conveniently located to the airport, and the cab from the airport cost just about 10 dollars. You can visit downtown Chicagao in about 40 minutes using the train which is available every 5-10 minutes... The suits are really well-furnished with an ample study room and a well equipped refrigerator. Great value for money. For free internet access, you need to be at the hotel lobby with your laptop-that's one downside. The reception is not so friendly, and seem stretched for time to give you attention.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: patrolman_pete
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the last couple days of a trip to Chicago. A few thoughts come to mind: Positive: -It is definitely convenient to the airport which is only a couple of exits away on the Interstate, and there is a shuttle. -There is an El (subway) stop right next to the hotel which makes it possible to explore downtown Chicago without having to bring your car along. -Unlike some airport hotels, there is a selection of basic amenities nearby, like supermarkets, restaurants, drug stores, etc. Some of them are more driving distance than walking distance, though. -Hotel is well kept with a nice, soaring lobby you wouldn't expect in such a place. -Staff were very friendly with some of the most helpful front desk staff I've ever encountered. It was a bit shortstaffed, but that may have been due to the July 4 holiday. -Rooms are quite spacious and reasonably well appointed (although they are starting to look a bit worn in places), and remarkably quiet considering the stream of jets passing overhead en route to O'Hare. Negatives -Parking is very expensive ($20/night) - I paid almost that much to park overnight downtown. -Still a long way into downtown Chicago if that's what you intend to do. On the whole I'd recommend it to anyone who needs to be in the O'Hare airport area.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a business meeting”
Reviews.Author: criticeoir
Reviews.Content: You canâ€™t beat the location of this hotel! It about two miles from Chicago airport (ORD) and it was easy to catch the shuttle back and forth. It is located in a very ordinary office park and is definitely a meeting/stopover hotel. I am not sure if all the rooms are suites. However, I got nice two-room suite on the 14th floor that was very well appointed. It even had a very comfortable desk that was facing the middle of the room not up against a wall. The bedroom was very comfortable and the bathroom recently updated. I had a business meting with colleagues from both coasts and this was perfect. The conference rooms were well equipped and easily catered for our group of 30. We had all our meals in an adjacent room and were served some of the best â€œbanquetâ€� food I have ever had. I especially liked their short ribs and halibut! The meeting snacks were really interesting ranging from mini-hotdogs to personal pizzas. I would recommend this hotel for business! The staff were very friendly and seemed to enjoy their jobs. Finally, one of my criteria for selecting a hotel is that it has to have somewhere decent to go for a run. I found a very nice park about a half-mile from the hotel that was easy to get to. It was mostly trail running and it was packed with deer!

Reviews.Title: “Needs some improvements.”
Reviews.Author: bing15
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night doing a park, sleep, fly. Room was pretty nice but safe was locked and staff have no way to reset it. Lost the tool. We had to spray the room to try to cover a smell. Internet cost about $10 per day extra. I think this hotel has seen better days. Restaurant was pretty good but dead. Airport transfer fine to airport. Terrible returning. Shuttle was to arrive in 10 mins. Took 25 but then was full.Waited again. Was an hour before we got back to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: notnow
Reviews.Content: I spent a Friday night here for a conference with a group of colleagues. The lobby and rooms are really pretty and trendy. Everything has a really open feel. Even the music in the lobby is nice. You can sit and use your laptop on their free wifi in the lobby. They charge you for use in the rooms. Nothing else is free here. If you like to exercise there is a gym in the lower lobby, but I went out to explore. It is not a very pretty area, being practically on the highway with a train station across the way. However, when I asked where I could go for a walk, I was directed to a beautiful forest reserve about 10 minutes walk from the hotel. I preferred that to a treadmill. There is a train station as I mentioned across the street and a Ginos pizza over the highway. I did not find much else within walking distance. I don't have a car, but I would personally not pay the $20 they charge here to park when there are a bunch of empty lots around on the weekend. finally, the airport shuutle runs every 1/2 hour and is very convenient. Not a bad stay.

Reviews.Title: “UNDERSTAFF HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jt93664
Reviews.Content: The room are decent, nice bathroom. One of our room got fridge and the other one got nothing. We call for a shuttle ride, it takes the frontdesk 30 mins to answer and put you on hold. Checkin is slow. Only 2 frontdesk employee and 20 people checkin . Restaurant food is low quality. Only a host 2 waiters running around. The room door is horrible, it slam down everytime someone leave the room.Its a nuisance and very unpleasant. Stay in Hyatt or doubletree hotel on River rd. Much better hotel and nicer lobby.
